title: Little Man
description: After leaving the prison, the dwarf criminal Calvin Sims joins to his moron brother Percy to steal an expensive huge diamond in a jewelry for the mobster Walken. They are chased by the police, and Calvin hides the stone in the purse of the executive Vanessa Edwards, whose husband Darryl Edwards wants to have a baby. Percy convinces Calvin to dress like a baby and be left in front of the Edwards's house to get inside the house and retrieve the diamond. Darryl and Vanessa keep Calvin for the weekend and decide to adopt him, while Walken threatens Darryl to get the stone back.

When I first saw the commercials for this movie I thought it would be one of those rare "gems" that Hollywood periodically spews out. However, this movie turned out to be a "tall order" and fell a heck of a ways "short" of a decent midget-ripping laugh.
Wow, another Wayans predictable garbage film, two thumbs down.

Nobody notices that the baby is a full-grown man. The "Little Man" is readily accepted as an infant. Meanwhile, quite pointedly, the filmmaker intergrated an African-American couple in an affluent, nearly all-white community, as a means, perhaps, to show that these people don't notice that their neighbors are indeed black. "Little Man" might "Something New" in code, or maybe it's the stupid low-brow film everybody says it is.
the story is very well acted out and easy to follow but the CGI takes the illusion away and ruins some of the jokes. either way i laughed out loud through the whole movie.

I can't list everything wrong with this movie in 5000 characters, so I'm not going to try. But really the main flaw is that, at no point in this movie did I laugh, to be honest I didn't even smirk at any point. I cringed, I felt physically sick, but at no point did this film approach anything vaguely resembling humour. And for a comedy not being comic is a real problem.

This is a bad film I will admit, however it is still entertaining and the Wayanas Bros. are just a likable duo that can make any film work to their advantage. They have done better, and this is probably their worst, but it still has some pretty funny moments. CGI was always going to be obviously dodgy and while its a clever concept it is indeed quite silly, but still its a funny movie that got laughs out of me. Overall it won't please everyone but will get laughs from the right audiences.
This movie is both  funny and dumb.. I recommend it for watching if you have a lot of free time. Otherwise don't waste your day. My final score is 5/10

"Little Man" was a very bad movie, which does not rescue the story, the comedy with which they handled, and the interpretation of the "adult" baby left me trolling and very angry. I do not like that movie.

Cheap lowbrow "slapstick " comedy that prioritizes puns and shock value over plot and dialogue. The dated and offensive stereotypes that plague this movie aren't even funny enough to justify their rudeness. The performances are the nails in the coffin with even talented actresses like Kerry Washington feel awful to watch. Nothing redeemable here.
